name: Hilton Norfolk Airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was one of the best hotel experiences we have had recently. We stay at hotels approximately 6-8 times a year in the mid-Atlantic area. The staff went beyond the norm and truly made us feel like they really wanted us at their establishment versus us being a bother to them. We will be returning to the Norfolk, Virginia Airport Hilton in the very near furture.
reviews.title: Excellent Customer Service

reviews.text: i cannot believe that this location is allowed to carry the hilton name. this name used to mean something...
reviews.title: worst hilton location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room smelled bad and the walls were paper thin. The desk clerk told me to wait a minute during check-in and then proceeded to finish her cell phone conversation concerning her sex life loudly in front of my kids!! I have stayed at numerous Hiltons as well as other brands, and this place was one of the worst. I had previously stayed at a small out of the way motel and I recieved much better customer service, and higher standards of cleanliness.
reviews.title: Nice room...except for the GIANT cockroach :(

reviews.text: Please, please do not stay at this disgusting place! pay $30 more and get a better smelling, clean, worthwhile room!!
reviews.title: Terrible Hilton

reviews.text: I was so thrilled when I arrived here since I had just left a roach infested hotel in the middle of the night and thought this would be my safe havem. So when I saw the room, it was gorgeous. Except...after dinner and when I was ready to go to bed, I saw a GIANT cockroach which my husband had to chase and kill.
reviews.title: Helpful Staff
Won't stay here again
reviews.text: Stayed here for one night before a flight out of Norfolk. I didn't have time to read reviews and shop around...wish I had. Overall I would say this is an 'acceptable' place to stay, however I'm sure better options can be found.

Tired old hotel in much need of renovation. Everything about this hotel says 1999: carpet, doors, fixtures, windows, etc. Note: The lobby area seemed to be nicer than what awaits upstairs, but who stays in the lobby?
reviews.title: Great for all

reviews.text: we had 2 rooms for 3 adults and 4 kids. very good.
reviews.title: BEWARE

reviews.text: the personal is very helpful. clean, no smell (smoke free) the indoor pool and spa were the hit for my small kids ! breakfast is not included.
reviews.title: Not going back there if I can help it.

reviews.text: very clean rooms and quiet hallways. they have redone the free parking lot .
reviews.title: Convenient Location, older hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: How this hotel could be part of the Hilton chain is beyond me. Checked in for a one night stay and was greeted by folks at the desk who were friendly and professional, this however is the only positive part of my experience at this hotel. Upon checking into the room, it was apparent that the hotel is old and outdated. The doors and walls are paper thin so every noise coming from the hallway, neighboring rooms are easily heard !! I even clearly heard a guy in the neighboring room cursing people making noise in the hall. There is a bar near that lobby, and the design of the hotel is such that you hear all the noise and conversation coming from the bar...at least on the second floor. The doors are so ill fitting that light shines underneath. Additionally, the bathroom was dirty. There was hair in the shower, somebody else's shampoo was in the shower, and there was some kind of red substance around the light switch. The airconditioning system in the room was loud as if there wasn't already enough sound to keep you awake all night. This Hotel isn't up to Hilton standards at all, and certainly isn't worth the money you'll pay to stay here ! Staff was friendly, when I checked out after two hours of trying to make the best of things.
reviews.title: How could this be a Hilton?

reviews.text: This hotel is very nice and has a very reasonable rate. The beds are comfortable, location is centrally located and the staff is very pleasant. The coffee shop is ok, bar is part of the restaurant with a very friendly staff. Free parking and free use of the office computers and printers.
reviews.title: Will be staying at this hotel every time we visit our daughter in college.

reviews.text: I was a single mother traveling with 2 children and needed a hotel with an airport shuttle, pool, & restaurant. This place had all I needed. All staff was friendly and helpful. Its true this is an older property that could use an updating (in rooms) But still overall clean. One easy upgrade they could do was make floor #1 hallway brighter, it feels like you are in a cave when you walk down there. Also some outside benchs would be helpful. It was nice having a Max n Ermas there, but staff there could have been a little friendlier and attentive = 2 mistakes made on our order and not alot of appology. Loved the concierge lounge and the indoor/outdoor pools = we used both. Beds were awesome! Would stay again.
reviews.title: Would Stay Again

reviews.text: Excuse my language please but I have been very disappointed in my stay here. I expected to stay at a high end hotel and it is ON THE LOBBY otherwise the elevator was broken the ice machine kept breaking the employees were very rude! Our sheets smelled as if they were just bleached instead of washed! My skin broke out because of them. My pillow had yellow stains and io called down but two hours later I still have not received a new pillow. There is open space to the rooms from the bar and I can hear the drunk people laughing and being obnoxious. I mean also some good things were that the hallway was quiet. Or creepy, however u wanna put it. The gym was very hot as well. The only things I found that are positive is the lobby is wat u would expect of a Hilton the beds were comfy and the tv and furniture was nice but the entire building needs to desperately be renovated. But of course once it is the prices will no longer be reasonable and it will become the way a Hilton should be. Overall this hotel LOOKED clean was very outdated and was quite trashy. I would not recommend it and I WILL NOT BE RETURNING I'll be staying at the ACTUAL Hilton on the ocean front this hotel is a disgrace to the name Hilton!
reviews.title: I was so disappointed THIS IS SUPPOSED TO BE A HILTON WTF

reviews.text: This was my 6th stay at this hotel this year. I ONLY stayed here because of the convenient location to the airport. The hotel rooms and in the hotel hallway smell like MILDEW. When there is a storm, the carpet in the hallway by the elevator gets SOAKING wet.
reviews.title: NO RESPECT! GOODBYE HILTON!!

reviews.text: Let me start by saying this is the toughest review I ever had to write so far, Why .... Because the staff, all the staff, from the manager to the wonderful ladies serving you in the executive lounge, to the maids trying hard to keep everything clean, are just so great in Customer Service. That being said, it is a waste to have them in this hotel with mold/ bugs and damp smells. I know the hotel is undergoing reservations from the top floors down (So, if you must stay here go for the sixth or fifth floor or you will be rolling the dice, that you might be carried out of your damp smelling, moldy room, by antes while you are sleeping in the middle of the night.) Nice thing is the Wonderful folks here will get you another room, (Took me three and my buddy two tries but we both found a nice one for our 10 days here) but the question you need to ask yourself, "is it really worth it", or should I wait until the hotel building undergoes all the renovations it so desperately needs, after which, and assuming they keep the same staff, this place will rival the Plaza Hotel in NYC.
reviews.title: Great Staff Trapped in a Hotel thats needs Renovations.

reviews.text: My wife and I spent a night here due to our flight being canceled. The reservation was made and paid for by the airline. The hotel appears to be an older property which is badly in need of a refresh. Check-in was easy and pleasant. When we got to our room the musty smell was obvious to both of us immediately. The room appeared clean but the windows are sealed shut and we just had to get used to the musty odor. The room was furnished reasonably well and the bed was OK with plenty of feather pillows.
reviews.title: Not what I expected from a Hilton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Maintenance seems to be a problem at this hotel. In our room there had bee obvious sloppy repairs done to the bathroom area. There were gaps between the ceiling and walls which had been patched at some point and never painted over. The hallway walls were scuffed and peeling paint was obvious in numerous places. We decided to go downstairs and try the indoor pool and spa, but the spa jets would not work the temperature of the water in the spa was scalding hot. We went to the front desk to warned them of the dangerously hot water in the spa and the clerk thanked us for warning her and said she would get maintenance to look at it right away.
reviews.title: Should not be a Hilton Brand hotel.

reviews.text: We had dinner at the on site restaurant and it was pretty good. The restaurant (Max & Erma's) is very much like the Chili's chain. The food was good and the young woman who served us was extremely helpful and pleasant.
reviews.title: Hilton Norfolk Airport

reviews.text: Shuttle service to and from the airport was free and the drivers were very professional
reviews.title: Good location, little out of date

description: The Hilton Norfolk Airport hotel is ideal for both business and leisure guests with our proximity to ORF Airport and complimentary shuttle service. Guest enjoy amenities including complimentary WiFi access, 24 hour business center, and 24 hour fitness center. Our hotel in Norfolk has an on-site restaurant, Max & Erma's, is open for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. With guest rooms, suites, and executive rooms to choose from, you are sure to enjoy your stay at our Hilton.
